Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-glazed pottery kotyle; interior glazed red-brown; exterior: wall glazed, fired black above, red-brown (with asdded red band) below; below, frieze of red-brown fired rays; inscription on exterior, near top of sherd.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Louvre AM1365 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA193.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.256) (phase 3)
